identificationModule.briefTitle: Enoblituzumab Plus MGA012 or MGD013 in Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Phase 2/3 Open-Label Trial to Evaluate Enoblituzumab in Combination With MGA012 or MGD013 in the First-Line Treatment of Patients With Recurrent or Metastatic Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This is an open-label study designed to evaluate safety and efficacy of enoblituzumab in combination with MGA012 or MGD013 in first-line treatment of patients with recurrent or metastatic squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck (SCCHN).
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The study will initially be conducted in 2 modules, Module X (enoblituzumab plus MGA012) and Module Y (enoblituzumab plus MGD013). Enrollment into Modules X and Y, with approximately 30 patients each, will occur independently in a non-randomized fashion. Data from these modules will determine if further evaluation will occur in randomized Module A (Phase 2) and randomized Module B (Phase 3).

conditions: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Head and Neck

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: Parallel study model refers to concurrent enrollment of non-randomized Modules X and Y.

interventions.name: MGD013
interventions.description: PD-1 X LAG-3 bispecific DART protein

primaryOutcomes.measure: Overall Response Rate (Modules X and Y)
primaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of patients with best overall response of complete response (CR) plus partial response (PR) per RECIST 1.1

primaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence of Adverse Events as assessed by CTCAE v 4.03 (Modules X and Y)
primaryOutcomes.description: Evaluation of adverse events and serious adverse events
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to 30 days after last dose of study drug

secondaryOutcomes.description: Time from start of study treatment to the first documented disease progression per RECIST v1.1 or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Disease Control Rate - (Modules X and Y)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of patients who experienced response of CR, PR or stable disease for at least 3 months from start of study treatment

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Duration of Response - (Modules X and Y)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Time from the date of initial response to the date of first documented progression or death from any cause, whichever occurs first
Percentage of patients developing anti-drug antibodies to enoblituzumab and/or MGA012
Percentage of patients developing anti-drug antibodies to enoblituzumab and/or MGD013
Maximum serum concentration of enoblituzumab and MGA012
Trough serum concentration of enoblituzumab and MGA012
Maximum serum concentration of enoblituzumab and MGD013
Trough serum concentration of enoblituzumab and MGD013

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Histologically proven, recurrent or metastatic SCCHN not curable by local therapy
* No prior systemic therapy for SCCHN in the recurrent or metastatic setting (with the exception of systemic therapy completed \> 6 months prior of given as part of multimodal treatment for locally advanced disease)
* Primary tumor locations of oropharynx, oral cavity, hypopharynx, or larynx
* At least one radiographically measurable lesion
* HPV test results available (positive and negative eligible)
* ECOG Performance status of 0 or 1
* Adequate end organ function
* Positive PD-L1 expression level (CPS â‰¥ 1%)

Exclusion Criteria:

* Disease suitable for local therapy administered with curative intent
* Progressive disease within 6 months of completion of curatively intended systemic treatment for locoregionally advanced SCCHN
* Radiation or other non-systemic therapy within 2 weeks of first dose of study drug
* Diagnosis of immunodeficiency, or use of immunosuppresive therapy within 14 days of first dose of study drug

meshes.term: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Head and Neck
